section.title: Overview
section.p: Each Org can have a Developer Portal site where you can publish your APIs to make them available to consumers outside the SnapLogic ecosystem. To match your organization’s brand, you can customize the appearance of your Developer Portal landing page and modify the suffix of the Developer Portal URL.
section.note: Because the Developer Portal is designed to be accessed by anyone who has the URL, all Developer Portal users must have at least read-only access to your published APIs. SnapLogic strongly recommends that you set up API policies if you prefer to restrict access to individual APIs.

step.cmd:
In SnapLogic Manager, go to
API Management Portal Manager Settings .

row.entry:
The suffix for your Developer Portal URL.
What you enter in this field is automatically appended to Portal URL.

The full URL to your Developer Portal.
To copy your Developer Portal URL to your clipboard, click the copy icon () next to the Portal URL value.

The thumbnail image for your Developer Portal.
The image must be JPG, PNG, or SVG with a maximum image size of 256px x 256px and a maximum file size of 10MB.

The background image for the landing page of your Developer Portal.
The image must be JPG, PNG, or SVG with a maximum image size of 2000px x 1200px and a maximum file size of 10MB.

The title of your Developer Portal. This appears at the top banner of all pages of your Developer Portal.
Must be no more than 50 characters.

The title displayed over your banner image in the landing page.
Must be no more than 120 characters.
The position of the Banner Image Text on the landing page: Left, Center, or Right.
The URL where API consumers can read the terms of service for using your Developer Portal and your APIs.
The email address where your API consumers can contact you.
Categories to classify published APIs in the Developer Portal. Category names must be unique within the Org.
The type of API documentation used for each API published in the Developer Portal.

step.cmd: Click Save. You can modify these settings at any time.
Validate your settings by clicking the external site icon () to launch your Developer Portal.
